page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The area covers the western suburbs of Sunderland and extends to the eastern edge of Washington New Town. The River Wear flows south west to north east across the area towards the North Sea. The A19 trunk road links the area to Teeside and Tyneside. Residental areas comprise post-war council estates at Pennywell, Grindon, Castletown and South Hylton, contrasting with Victorian terraced cottages, private developments and the modern designs of Washington. Agricultural land is mainly rough grazing in conjunction with industrial crop cultivation of rape seed. The heavy industrial origins of the area have been superceded by purpose built suburban light industrial estates. Recreational facilities include golf, parks and a water fowl refuge.
